org.fcrepo.client.objecteditor.types

Class DatastreamBindingRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fcrepo.client.objecteditor.types.DatastreamBindingRule

  • public class DatastreamBindingRule
extends Object
    A single rule of a service deployment's datastream binding specification. For a certain binding key (the "key" of the rule), a rule specifies a range indicating the number of datastreams to be bound, whether order is important, and the types of datastreams that may be bound.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatastreamBindingRule

        public DatastreamBindingRule(String key,
                     String inputLabel,
                     String inputInstruction,
                     int min,
                     int max,
                     boolean orderMatters,
                     String[] types)
        Initialize a DatastreamBindingRule with all values. If maximum is -1, that means there is no maximum. If the array of types is null or empty, getTypes() will return a single-valued array with the "any type" pattern.

        public int getMax()
        Get the maximum number of datastreams that can be bound. -1 means there is no maximum.

        Get the minimum number of datastreams that can be bound.

      • orderMatters

        Does order matter?

      • getTypes

        public String[] getTypes()
        Get the type list. This will always have at least one element.
